intro: Psoralea caffra, commonly known as the African yellowwood, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is typically shrub-like, with a woody stem and can grow up to 2 meters in height. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Psoralea caffra is also valued for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine.
